text: Is the following statement true or false? "The words we choose when writing affects the way the message is received".
Which of the following should you generally do in written communication? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Use lingo and jargon without considering the audience
Add information that is not relevant to help educate the reader
Know your goal and state it clearly
Explain jargon and industry terms for those with less experience.
Stay on topic and keep it concise.
Keep it as short and informational as possible to convey the meaning
Use fancy words to sound intelligent and well informed.

text:
The content of a message sent is either transactional, instructional or informational.

Match the following definitions to the correct type of written communication.

answers.text: A message sent to get results. The intention is to get a response from the person the message was sent to. It can be a quick clarification, a request for a meeting or asking for a favor.
The sender delivers a message for the receiver's benefit. This type of communication can be sent to an individual or group, is less dependent on the receiver and there is no response needed,
The sender gives the receiver directions for a specific task. This type of communication should be detailed and easy to understand.

text: Is the following statement true or false "A great advantage of written communication is that the message can be referred back to at a later time".
Which of the following should be true about written communication? (Select all that are applicable).
All effective written communication has some characteristics in common. Match the Cs of effective written communication to the correct definition.

answers.text: Forms a link between the reader and the writer.
The reason for writing needs to be clear to both the writer and the reader.
Good written communication should communicate what you want to convey in the least possible words.
To be effective written communication should use the correct tone, inoffensive language and appropriate grammar.
The message should show the sender’s expression as well as should respect the receiver. The sender of the message should be sincerely polite, judicious, reflective and enthusiastic.
Effective communication must give thought to the audience. The words of the message should be modified to suit the audience's needs.
The message should be particular and clear rather than unclear andgeneral
The communication should convey all the facts required by by the audience.

text: Project managers typically spend a large portion of their time communicating to ensure the success of their project. Which of the following are considered purposes for communications in project management? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Build consensus among the project team
To assign tasks, roles and responsibilities
Inform or solicit input as part of a decision.

text: Written communication is crucial to document all aspects of an ongoing project. Which of the following are true for written communication in a project?

answers.text: Enables the project team to review decisions later on.
Enables the project team to bring new team members up to speed.
Enables sharing the information without accidentally altering or distorting the meaning.
